item.title: Amy add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I don't know the question, but sex is definitely the answer." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Amy add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "People sleep peaceably in their beds at night only because rough men stand ready to do violence on their behalf." -- George Orwell

item.title: Amy add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I wonder how many people I've looked at all my life and never seen." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Amy add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "We have only one story. All novels, all poetry, are built on the neverending contest in ourselves of good and evil. And it occurs to me that evil must constantly respawn, while good, while virtue, is immortal. Vice has always a new fresh young face, while virtue is venerable as nothing else in the world is." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Amy add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Amy add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Amy add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Amy add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Atheism turns out to be too simple. If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning..." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Amy add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon

item.title: Amy add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "When I stand before God at the end of my life, I would hope that I would not have a single bit of talent left, and could say, 'I used everything you gave me." -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Amy add a quote by Nelson Mandela
item.description: "When a man is denied the right to live the life he believes in, he has no choice but to become an outlaw." -- Nelson Mandela

item.title: Amy add a quote by Mother Theresa
item.description: "I know God won't give me anything I can't handle. I just wish he didn't trust me so much." -- Mother Theresa

item.title: Amy add a quote by Kent M. Keith
item.description: "The good you do today may be forgotten tomorrow. Do good anyway." -- Kent M. Keith

item.title: Amy add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Anything that just costs money is cheap." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Amy add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "It seems to me that if you or I must choose between two courses of thought or action, we should remember our dying and try so to live that our death brings no pleasure to the world." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Amy add a quote by John Piper
item.description: "Reading is more important to me than eating." -- John Piper

item.title: Amy add a quote by John Piper
item.description: "One of the great uses of Twitter and Facebook will be to prove at the Last Day that prayerlessness was not from lack of time." -- John Piper

item.title: Amy add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "How often it is a small, almost unconscious event that makes a turning point." -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: Amy add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "This is what the past is for! Every experience God gives us, every person He puts in our lives is the perfect preparation for the future that only He can see." -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: Amy add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "And so seated next to my father in the train compartment, I suddenly asked, "Father, what is sexsin?" He turned to look at me, as he always did when answering a question, but to my surprise he said nothing. At last he stood up, lifted his traveling case off the floor and set it on the floor. Will you carry it off the train, Corrie?" he said. I stood up and tugged at it. It was crammed with the watches and spare parts he had purchased that morning. It's too heavy," I said. Yes," he said, "and it would be a pretty poor father who would ask his little girl to carry such a load. It's the same way, Corrie, with knowledge. Some knowledge is too heavy for children. When you are older and stronger, you can bear it. For now you must trust me to carry it for you." -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: Amy add a quote by David Byrne
item.description: "Sometimes it's a form of love just to talk to somebody that you have nothing in common with and still be fascinated by their presence." -- David Byrne

item.title: Amy add a quote by Christopher Rice
item.description: "Everyday is a bank account, and time is our currency. No one is rich, no one is poor, we've got 24 hours each." -- Christopher Rice

item.title: Amy add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "Let me ask you one question Is your money that good Will it buy you forgiveness Do you think that it could I think you will find When your death takes its toll All the money you made Will never buy back your soul" -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Amy add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "it was her habit to build up laughter out of inadequate materials." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Amy add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Amy add a quote by Fiona Apple
item.description: "When you're surrounded by all these people, it can be lonelier than when you're by yourself. You can be in a huge crowd, but if you don't feel like you can trust anyone or talk to anybody, you feel like you're really alone." -- Fiona Apple

item.title: Amy add a quote by Elizabeth Wurtzel
item.description: "I feel like a defective model, like I came off the assembly line flat-out fucked and my parents should have taken me back for repairs before the warranty ran out." -- Elizabeth Wurtzel

item.title: Amy add a quote by Kay Redfield Jamison
item.description: "Others imply that they know what it is like to be depressed because they have gone through a divorce, lost a job, or broken up with someone. But these experiences carry with them feelings. Depression, instead, is flat, hollow, and unendurable. It is also tiresome. People cannot abide being around you when you are depressed. They might think that they ought to, and they might even try, but you know and they know that you are tedious beyond belief: you are irritable and paranoid and humorless and lifeless and critical and demanding and no reassurance is ever enough. You're frightened, and you're frightening, and you're "not at all like yourself but will be soon," but you know you won't." -- Kay Redfield Jamison
